      • Lcd1602

        public Lcd1602(boolean fourbitmode,
               java.lang.String rs,
               java.lang.String rw,
               java.lang.String enable,
               java.lang.String d0,
               java.lang.String d1,
               java.lang.String d2,
               java.lang.String d3,
               java.lang.String d4,
               java.lang.String d5,
               java.lang.String d6,
               java.lang.String d7)
        throws java.io.IOException
         When the display powers up, it is configured as follows:
 1. Display clear
 2. Function set:
   DL = 1; 8-bit interface data
   N = 0; 1-line display
   F = 0; 5x8 dot character font
 3. Display on/off control:
   D = 0; Display off
   C = 0; Cursor off
   B = 0; Blinking off
 4. Entry mode set:
   I/D = 1; Increment by 1
   S = 0; No shift

 Note, however, that resetting the Arduino doesn't reset the LCD, so we
 can't assume that it's in that state when a sketch starts (and the
 Lcd1602a constructor is called).
        抛出:
        java.io.IOException
